data.title: USA TODAY
data.meta_description: World Peace was recently amnestied by the Los Angeles Lakers
data.text:
Metta World Peace met with the New York Knicks in Las Vegas Monday and has plans to meet with other teams.

World Peace is also planning to meet with former NBA player Yao Ming, who is an owner of a team in China, about the possibility of playing there.

He was amnestied by the Los Angeles Lakers, who still be paid the $7.7 million he's owed in the final season of his deal, but the team that signs him would assume part of the cost.

USA TODAY Sports reported earlier that World Peace is interested in joining a contender â€“ namely the New York Knicks, Los Angeles Clippers, Brooklyn Nets, Chicago Bulls, Miami Heat, Oklahoma City Thunder, San Antonio Spurs or Indiana Pacers. He is not interested in joining a rebuilding team.
